page.title: 06OCCUPATIONS
page.content: The largest single employer in the area is the National Coal Board, with both Bevercotes and Ollerton collieries less than four miles away. Outside of coal mining there is a tremendous cross-section of trades amongst the male members of the community, including unskilled, semi-skilled, and skilled workers as well as the professionals such as doctors and company directors. The women in employment who answered our survey displayed a similar span of occupations but with more emphasis on skilled and office workers. Most people who are employed travel to their places of work by car, with very few using public transport. Although a large number of people travel between 3 and 5 miles there is a significant percentage who travel over 20 miles to work.
